page.title: 02CASTLETOWN
page.content: The origin of the village's name is not known,but it may be so called because Shelly Hill was mistaken for a ruined castle. Castletown as it now stands came into being at the end of the 18th century when{James Traill}opened up the{Quarries}to produce good quality flagstones.Small houses made of{ {flagstone}line the main street. In the 1920's the quarries closed down.The village is now largely a dormitory village for{Thurso}and{ {Dounreay}.There is new housing in the form of council houses and private bungalows.There is also an estate of houses belonging to the{American Naval {Bases}which are sited at{Forss and {Murkle}.Castletown now has a population of 1 000 .The village also has its own {Police station},primary school,garages and a few shops.
